description: A skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells.
precautions: Wash face gently, avoid oily cosmetics, consult a dermatologist for severe cases.

description: A condition causing inflamed, itchy, cracked, and rough skin.
precautions: Moisturize regularly, avoid irritants, follow prescribed medications.

description: A disease that causes red, itchy scaly patches, most commonly on the knees, elbows, trunk and scalp.
precautions: Use prescribed creams, avoid triggers like stress and alcohol, maintain skin hydration.

description: A chronic skin condition that causes redness and visible blood vessels in your face.
precautions: Avoid sun exposure, use sunscreen, avoid triggers such as spicy foods and alcohol.

description: A disease that causes the loss of skin color in patches.
precautions: Use sunscreen to protect affected areas, consider camouflage cosmetics, consult a dermatologist.

description: A serious form of skin cancer that develops in the cells that produce melanin.
precautions: Avoid excessive sun exposure, use sunscreen, monitor moles and skin changes, consult doctor immediately.

description: A type of skin cancer that begins in the basal cells.
precautions: Avoid sun exposure, regular skin checks, surgical removal or treatment as advised.

description: A common form of skin cancer that develops in the squamous cells.
precautions: Protect skin from sun, monitor for changes, consult dermatologist for biopsy or treatment.

description: Small, rough growths caused by a viral infection.
precautions: Avoid picking at warts, use over-the-counter treatments, see dermatologist for persistent cases.

description: A fungal infection that causes a ring-shaped rash.
precautions: Keep skin dry, use antifungal creams, avoid sharing personal items.

description: A highly contagious skin infection that causes red sores.
precautions: Maintain hygiene, avoid scratching, use prescribed antibiotics.

description: A bacterial infection of the skin and tissues beneath.
precautions: Keep skin clean, monitor for spread, seek antibiotics treatment.

description: Red, itchy welts that result from a skin reaction.
precautions: Avoid triggers, use antihistamines, keep skin cool.

description: A viral infection causing a painful rash.
precautions: Consult doctor for antiviral medication, avoid contact with vulnerable individuals, manage pain.

description: Inflammation of the skin causing redness, swelling, and itching.
precautions: Avoid irritants, use moisturizers, follow prescribed treatments.

description: Rash associated with systemic lupus erythematosus, often butterfly-shaped on the face.
precautions: Use sunscreen, avoid sun exposure, follow treatment for lupus.

description: Small blisters around the mouth caused by the herpes simplex virus.
precautions: Avoid close contact, use antiviral creams, maintain hygiene.

description: A viral infection causing small, firm bumps.
precautions: Avoid scratching, keep skin clean, consult dermatologist if persistent.

description: A condition that causes scaly patches, red skin, and dandruff.
precautions: Use medicated shampoos, moisturize affected areas, avoid harsh skin products.

description: A rough, scaly patch on the skin caused by years of sun exposure.
precautions: Use sunscreen, monitor for changes, consult doctor for cryotherapy or treatment.

description: A cancer that forms in the lining of blood and lymph vessels.
precautions: Seek oncologist consultation, manage underlying conditions like HIV, follow treatment plan.

description: A fungal infection causing small, discolored patches of skin.
precautions: Keep skin dry, use antifungal creams, avoid excessive sweating.

description: A viral infection causing sores in mouth and rashes on hands and feet.
precautions: Maintain hygiene, avoid close contact, manage symptoms with hydration and pain relief.

description: Chronic autoimmune skin condition causing lesions and scarring.
precautions: Avoid sun exposure, follow prescribed treatment, monitor skin changes.

description: A skin reaction that can be triggered by infections or medications.
precautions: Avoid triggers, seek medical attention, use prescribed medications.

description: An autoimmune skin disease causing large, fluid-filled blisters.
precautions: Consult dermatologist, use prescribed immunosuppressive therapy, avoid skin trauma.
